meta.seo_title: Free Anatomy and Physiology Textbook for Download
meta.search_description: Learn about human anatomy and physiology online by downloading OpenStax's free Anatomy and Physiology book and using our accompanying study guide.

title: Anatomy and Physiology
description: Anatomy and Physiology is a dynamic textbook for the two-semester human anatomy and physiology course for life science and allied health majors. The book is organized by body system and covers standard scope and sequence requirements. Its lucid text, strategically constructed art, career features, and links to external learning tools address the critical teaching and learning challenges in the course. The web-based version of Anatomy and Physiology also features links to surgical videos, histology, and interactive diagrams.

book_student_resources.resource_description: Congratulations! You've got a free textbook. Download this guide to learn how to use it.
This guide helps students learn the correct pronunciation of key terms in Anatomy and Physiology.
AnatomyZone has partnered with OpenStax to supplement videos with high-quality illustrations and interactive, multiple-choice questions.
Need help studying? Access detailed solutions to problems and exercises in your OpenStax book.
Adapted from OpenStax College Success, this guide discusses effective reading approaches, study tips, and notetaking strategies for students.
Adapted from OpenStax College Success, this guide includes information about estimating time on tasks, avoiding procrastination, and using strategies to stick to your priorities.

These resources contain chapter outlines with key concepts, terms, and questions. They are designed to provide a note-taking framework and enhance student understanding in reading and course sessions.

Let us make lectures a little easier for you. We’ve got PowerPoint slides with all the images from the book, organized by chapter.
The instructor solutions guide contains the instructor-facing answers to the problems and exercises within the textbook.

book_faculty_resources.resource_description:
Minnesota State University, Mankato created a course cartridge for this title to integrate your OpenStax book into the D2L learning management system. Download this file and read the attached help article to import this resource into D2L. Please note that to use the book's highlighting and note-taking feature in D2L, you and your students will need to be logged into your individual OpenStax accounts on openstax.org.

Instructions for importing the D2L Cartridge

OpenStax created a course cartridge for this title to integrate into the Moodle learning management system. The file is formally a “backup” of the original course. Download it and work with your administrator or use the Restore function to add to your course.

Instructions for importing the Moodle Cartridge.

Expert faculty have selected 5 – 10 openly licensed videos for each chapter that unpack key concepts. In addition to video links, this resource provides metadata like time stamps, synopses, and PowerPoint alignment to facilitate seamless integration into your course materials.

rex_callout_blurb: New Highlight and add notes — it’s 100% free!
errata_content: All OpenStax textbooks undergo a rigorous review process. However, like any professional-grade textbook, errors sometimes occur. This book has a new edition available, and errata are no longer being accepted for the old edition. Please find the newest edition of this book on openstax.org/subjects.
customization_form_subheading: Please select the modules (up to 10), that you want to customize with Google Docs.
customization_form_disclaimer:
Disclaimer

The following features and functionality are not available to teachers and students using Google Docs customized content:

  • Errata updates. OpenStax webview is updated at least twice yearly. Customized Google Docs will not receive these content updates.
  • Access to study tools. OpenStax webview has in-book search, highlighting, study guides, and more available for free. This functionality will not be available in Google Docs versions.
  • Formatting. Print books and webview have a specific design and structure format developed for those platforms. These functionalities are not available in the Google Docs versions.
customization_form_next_steps:
Next Steps

  1. Within two business days, you will receive an email for each module that you have requested access to customize.
  2. The link provided in the email will be your own copy of the Google Doc that OpenStax generated for you.
  3. Once you have accessessed the document you can make the changes you desire and share with your students. We recommend using the "Publish to the Web" functionality under the file menu for sharing with students.
featured_resources_header: Resources for taking your course online
support_statement: With philanthropic support, this book is used in classrooms, saving students dollars this school year. Learn more about our impact and how you can help.
